jcr:content.jcr:title: United Arab Emirates at the 2004 Summer Olympics

contentheadline.headline: United Arab Emirates at the 2004 Summer Olympics

contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Olympics United Arab Emirates |games=2004 Summer |competitors= 4 (4 men, 0 women) |sports= 3 |flagbearer=[[Saeed bin Maktoum bin Rashid Al Maktoum|Saeed Al Maktoum]] |gold=1 |silver=0 |bronze=0 |total=1 |rank=54 }} The '''[[United Arab Emirates]]''' competed at the '''[[2004 Summer Olympics]]''' in [[Athens]], [[Greece]]. The nation won its first ever Olympic medal at these Games. ==Medalists== {{MedalCountryTop}} {{MedalCountryGold| [[Ahmad Mohammad Hasher Al Maktoum|Ahmed Al Maktoum]]|[[Shooting at the 2004 Summer Olympics|Shooting]], Men's Double Trap }} {{MedalCountryBottom}} ==Results by event== ===[[Athletics at the 2004 Summer Olympics|Athletics]]=== '''[[Athletics at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's 800 metres|Men's 800 metres]]:''' * [[Ali Mohammed Ali Al Balooshi]] **Round 1: 1:51.76 (8th in heat 7, did not advance, 68th overall) ===[[Shooting at the 2004 Summer Olympics|Shooting]]=== [[Ahmad Mohammad Hasher Al Maktoum|Ahmed Al Maktoum]] won the UAE's first ever Olympic medal, a gold, with a dominant performance in the Double Trap, three days after falling one shot short of a chance for a medal in the Trap. Al Maktoum shot three rounds of 48 in qualifying to beat [[Russell Mark]]'s Olympic record of 143 set in [[Shooting at the 2000 Summer Olympics|Sydney]], and took a six-point lead into the final, where he again shot the best round and equaled another Olympic record, this time Mark's from [[Shooting at the 1996 Summer Olympics|Atlanta]]. '''[[Shooting at the 2004 Summer Olympics - Men's trap|Men's Trap]]:''' * [[Ahmad Mohammad Hasher Al Maktoum|Ahmed Al Maktoum]] **Qualification: 121 points (T-4th overall, ''Qualified'') **'''Final''': 23 points (Total: 144 points, 4th overall) '''[[Shooting at the 2004 Summer Olympics - Men's double trap|Men's Double Trap]]:''' * [[Ahmad Mohammad Hasher Al Maktoum|Ahmed Al Maktoum]] **Qualification: 144 points (1st overall, ''Qualified'') ('''Olympic Record''') **'''Final''': 45 points (Total: 189 points) '''(Gold Medal)''' ('''Equal Olympic Record''') '''[[Shooting at the 2004 Summer Olympics - Men's skeet|Men's Skeet]]:''' * [[Saeed bin Maktoum bin Rashid Al Maktoum|Saeed Al Maktoum]] **Qualification: 114 points (37th overall, did not advance) ===[[Swimming at the 2004 Summer Olympics|Swimming]]=== '''[[Swimming at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's 100 metre freestyle|Men's 100 metre Freestyle]]:''' * [[Obaid Al Jasmi]] **Heat: 54.17 s (58th overall, did not advance) ==Officials== *President: Hh Sheikh Ahmed Bin Saeed Al Maktoum *Secretary General: S.e. M. Ibrahim Abdul Malik Mohammad ==References== *[http://www.la84foundation.org/6oic/OfficialReports/2004/Results/ Official Report of the XXVIII Olympiad] {{Nations at the 2004 Summer Olympics}} [[Category:Nations at the 2004 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:United Arab Emirates at the Olympics|2004]] [[Category:2004 in the United Arab Emirates|Olympics]]
